Sul mercato si vedono le quotazioni espr: On the market you can see the quotes expressed with two reference rates, e.g. EUR / USD 1.1534 /1.1536. The price on the left is referred to as the "bid" price or the money price and is the price at which a trader is willing to buy a currency pair. Conversely, the price on the right is referred to as the ask price or letter or offer price, that is, the price at which a trader is willing to sell a currency pair. The differential between the bid price and the ask price is commonly known with the English term spread. This is the cost of the trading operation. In our example, this differential is equal to 0.0002. For convenience of notation, we tend to indicate it as 2 pips (point in price or percentage in point).
